intro: Carissa arduina, commonly known as the Natal plumbago, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows up to 2 meters tall, featuring dense, spiny branches and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its fruit is a small, yellow, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Carissa arduina is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
